snippet: Mr. Abbado led some of the world’s most revered musical institutions, including La Scala, the Vienna State Opera and the Berlin Philharmonic.
abstract: Claudio Abbado, conductor whose refined interpretations of large symphonic and operatic repertory won him directorships of several of the world's most revered musical institutions, dies at age 80.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Abbado led some of the world’s most revered musical institutions, including La Scala, the Vienna State Opera and the Berlin Philharmonic.

headline.main: Claudio Abbado, an Italian Conductor With a Global Reach, Is Dead at 80
headline.print_headline: Claudio Abbado, an Italian Conductor With a Global Reach, Is Dead at 80
